intro: Lellingeria ascensionensis, commonly known as the Ascension Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the island of Ascension in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple blooms that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the island's unique climate and soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
